io.realm

Class SyncConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.realm.RealmConfiguration
      • io.realm.SyncConfiguration

  • public class SyncConfiguration
extends RealmConfiguration
    An SyncConfiguration is used to setup a Realm that can be synchronized between devices using the Realm Object Server.

    A valid SyncUser is required to create a SyncConfiguration. See SyncCredentials and SyncUser.loginAsync(SyncCredentials, String, SyncUser.Callback) for more information on how to get a user object.

    A minimal SyncConfiguration can be found below. 

     
 SyncConfiguration config = new SyncConfiguration.Builder(context)
   .serverUrl("realm://objectserver.realm.io/~/default")
   .user(myUser)
   .build();
    Synchronized Realms only support additive migrations which can be detected and performed automatically, so the following builder options are not accessible compared to a normal Realm:
    • deleteRealmIfMigrationNeeded()
    • schemaVersion(long version)
    • migration(Migration)
    Synchronized Realms are created by using Realm.getInstance(RealmConfiguration) and Realm.getDefaultInstance() like ordinary unsynchronized Realms.

      • getServerUrl

        public URI getServerUrl()
        Returns the fully disambiguated URI for the remote Realm i.e., the /~/ placeholder has been replaced by the proper user ID.
        Returns:
        URI identifying the remote Realm this local Realm is synchronized with.

      • shouldDeleteRealmOnLogout

        public boolean shouldDeleteRealmOnLogout()
        Returns true if the Realm file must be deleted once the SyncUser owning it logs out.
        Returns:
        true if the Realm file must be deleted if the SyncUser logs out. false if the file is allowed to remain behind.
